left.name: specimen_type
left.description: Description of the kind of specimen that was collected with respect to tumour/normal tissue origin.

codeList: Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumour - metastasis to distant location
Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line
Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour

Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line
Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour

left.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

data.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

left.name: pathological_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: pathological_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

restrictions.script: validateWithMagic(only needed if tumour_staging_system=AJCC)

left.name: pathological_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

right.name: pathological_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

restrictions.script: validateWithMagic(only needed if tumour_staging_system=AJCC)

description.data: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: pathological_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: pathological_m_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: pathological_stage_group
left.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

data.name: pathological_stage_group
data.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

data.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

left.name: tumour_histological_type
left.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

right.name: tumour_histological_type
right.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3).

left.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

data.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

left.description: Description of technique used to process specimen.

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

left.name: specimen_storage
left.description: Description of how specimen was stored for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

data.name: specimen_storage
data.description: Description of how specimen was stored for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

left.name: central_pathology_confirmed
left.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

right.name: central_pathology_confirmed
right.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

left.name: tumour_grading_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to  grow.

right.name: tumour_grading_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to  grow.

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

restrictions.script: validateWithMagic(set the possible values based on system selected above)

script.data: validateWithMagic(set the possible values based on system selected above)

left.name: percent_tumour_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

right.name: percent_tumour_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

left.name: percent_proliferating_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

right.name: percent_proliferating_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

left.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

right.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

left.name: percent_stromal_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

right.name: percent_stromal_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

left.name: percent_necrosis
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

right.name: percent_necrosis
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

left.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system

data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

data.name: clinical_stage_group
data.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

left.name: stage_suffix
left.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

data.name: stage_suffix
data.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

left.name: clinical_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: clinical_t_category
data.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: clinical_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: clinical_n_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: clinical_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

data.name: clinical_m_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

left.name: presenting_symptoms
left.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

data.name: presenting_symptoms
data.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

left.name: performance_status
left.description: Indicate the patient's performance status at the time of primary diagnosis (ECOG performance score https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

codeList: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction
Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work)
Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours
Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours
Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

data.name: performance_status
data.description: Indicate the patient's performance status at the time of primary diagnosis (ECOG performance score https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

codeList: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction
Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work)
Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours
Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours
Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
left.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
data.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

left.name: recurrence_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: recurrence_t_category
data.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: recurrence_n_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: recurrence_m_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: recurrence_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

data.name: recurrence_stage_group
data.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
left.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

data.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. This may be represented as ypTNM or ycTNM in the medical report.
data.name: posttherapy_tumour_staging_system

left.name: posttherapy_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: posttherapy_t_category
data.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: posttherapy_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: posttherapy_n_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: posttherapy_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

data.name: posttherapy_m_category
data.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

left.name: posttherapy_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting posttherapy_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

right.name: tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

right.name: tumor_normal_designation
right.description: Description of the kind of tissue that was collected with respect to disease status.

codeList: Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour
Metastatic tumour - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumour - metastasis to distant location
Xenograft - derived from tumour cell line
Cell line - derived from xenograft tissue
